qas.question: Who was the major opponent to Freemasonry?
Which countries had a large Catholic element and therefore had confrontation with Freemasons?
Do American historians downplay or attribute the importance of Freemasonry in causing the American Revolution?
Who was the political enemy of the Patriots?
Were the Masons political or non-political in the American Revolution?

context: The major opponent of Freemasonry was the <a0_0>Roman Catholic Church<a0_0/>, so that in countries with a large Catholic element, such as <a1_0>France, Italy, Spain, and Mexico<a1_0/>, much of the ferocity of the political battles involve the confrontation between what Davies calls the reactionary Church and enlightened Freemasonry. Even in France, Masons did not act as a group. American historians, while noting that Benjamin Franklin and George Washington were indeed active Masons, have <a2_0>downplay<a2_0/>ed the importance of Freemasonry in causing the American Revolution because the Masonic order was <a4_0>non-political<a4_0/> and included both Patriots and their enemy <a3_0>the Loyalists<a3_0/>.
